content: 4.1, “IBM Cloud Infrastructure Center” on page 84  4.2, “OpenShift” on page 85  4.3, “Operations Manager” on page 88  4.4, “Backup and Restore Manager” on page 89  4.5, “CMS Pipelines and VM utilities” on page 91  4.6, “zSecure Manager for RACF z/VM” on page 93 4 84 Virtualization Cookbook: Vol 1: IBM z/VM 7.2 4.1 IBM Cloud Infrastructure Center IBM Cloud Infrastructure Center is an Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) management solution. It provides on-premises cloud deployment of Linux guests under z/VM and integrates with high-level cloud automation tools; for example, IBM Cloud Automation Manager, VMware vRealize Automation (vRA), and vRealize Orchestration (vRO). It is built with OpenStack compatible APIs, which allows current OpenStack implementations to easily integrate a z/VM environment. 4.1.1 Infrastructure management Cloud Infrastructure Center provides a consistent experience to manage the virtualization environment (see Figure 4-1). It allows the definition,
